resources.string: is an application which offers your next probable destination to your favourite journey planner without you needing to type anything.

To do this Mobility Profile needs permissions to read your calendar and access your location. You can always switch them off.

 If you have calendar events, Mobility profile will suggest them.

 And with your location data Mobility Profile will learn step by step to predict your next destination.
You can add your favorite places, and they will show up in your destination suggestions. In addition, Mobility Profile will suggest new places based on tracking.
Reset app and delete all data
Back up your data. The database file, called mobilityprofile.db, will be saved to your main folder of internal storage.
Deletes all route searches you\'ve made.
Deletes all collected data, including location history, searched routes and favourite places.
Save this suggestion as a favourite?
The following applications have defined conflicting permissions with Mobility Profile:\n

If two or more applications define the same permission, the application that is installed first is the one whose definition is used. Applications listed above were installed before Mobility Profile and have defined the same permission as Mobility Profile. To solve the problem, uninstall those applications, then run Mobility Profile and make sure this message is no longer shown. After that you can reinstall those applications. \n\nMore information about the problem can be found at https://datatheorem.github.io/2014/04/16/custom-permissions/
Allows the software to use information provided by Mobility Profile. Exact data collected by Mobility Profile won\'t be shared, only suggestions Mobility Profile is giving based on that data.
Mobility Profile is tracking your location
